p: In vivo, a 3-days uterotrophic assay and a 9-weeks oral treatment in ovariectomized adult rats were tested. AEL at the doses of 50, 100 and 200Â mg/kg p. o. did not induce endometrium proliferation either in the 3-days or the 9-weeks treatment regimens, but induced vaginal stratification and cornification ( Ateba et al., 2013). This tissue-dependent effect suggests that AEL could prevent vaginal dryness experienced by menopausal women, while not inducing the unwanted uterine proliferation. In the other hand, the decoction of aerial parts of E. laurentii had no significant effect on the uterine and vaginal endpoints at all tested doses following a 3-days uterotrophic assay ( Ateba et al., 2014c).
